alert.note: Alert for Lower Treasure Valley; Owyhee Mountains; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 1:08PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ada, southwestern Elmore and west central Owyhee Counties through 145 PM MDT... At 108 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Toy Pass, or 43 miles south of Nampa, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Toy Pass around 110 PM MDT. Doyle Mountain around 120 PM MDT. Oreana around 130 PM MDT. Grand View, Mountain Home Air Force Base, Bruneau and Big Foot Butte around 140 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Lower Treasure Valley; Owyhee Mountains; Southwest Highlands; Upper Treasure Valley
